title: Introduction to Scratch Programming
description: Learn programming fundamentals through Scratch's visual programming environment, creating interactive projects and games.
subject: ICT
achievementDescription: Create interactive programs using visual programming concepts

text.introduction: Scratch is a visual programming language that makes learning programming fun and accessible. Instead of typing complex code, you drag and drop colorful blocks to create programs. This approach helps beginners understand programming concepts while creating games, animations, and interactive stories.

sections.title: Getting Started with Scratch
sections.content:
**What is Scratch?**
• Visual programming language developed by MIT
• Uses drag-and-drop blocks instead of text code
• Perfect for beginners to learn programming concepts
• Free to use online at scratch.mit.edu

**Scratch Interface:**
• **Stage:** Where your program runs and displays output
• **Sprites:** Characters or objects in your program
• **Scripts Area:** Where you build programs with blocks
• **Blocks Palette:** Library of programming blocks
• **Costumes:** Different appearances for sprites
• **Sounds:** Audio files for your projects

**Basic Concepts:**
• Programs are built by connecting blocks
• Each sprite can have its own scripts
• Green flag starts the program
• Red button stops the program

sections.title: Programming Concepts in Scratch
sections.content:
**Sequence:** Blocks execute in order from top to bottom
```
When green flag clicked
Say "Hello Ghana!" for 2 seconds
Move 10 steps
Play sound "pop"
```

**Selection (Conditionals):** Making decisions
```
If <touching edge?> then
  Turn 180 degrees
End
```

**Iteration (Loops):** Repeating actions
```
Repeat 4 times
  Move 100 steps
  Turn 90 degrees
End
```

**Variables:** Storing and using data
```
Set [score] to 0
Change [score] by 10
Say [score] for 2 seconds
```

**Events:** Starting scripts based on actions
• When green flag clicked
• When key pressed
• When sprite clicked
• When I receive message

sections.title: Creating Your First Project
sections.content:
**Ghana Flag Animation Project:**

**Step 1:** Create sprites for flag colors
• Red rectangle sprite
• Yellow rectangle sprite  
• Green rectangle sprite
• Black star sprite

**Step 2:** Position sprites
• Red at top
• Yellow in middle
• Green at bottom
• Star in center of yellow

**Step 3:** Add animation
• Make flag wave using costume changes
• Add sound effects
• Create interactive buttons

**Programming Blocks Needed:**
• Motion blocks (go to x: y:)
• Looks blocks (switch costume)
• Sound blocks (play sound)
• Events blocks (when clicked)
• Control blocks (forever, wait)

sections.title: Advanced Scratch Features
sections.content:
**Custom Blocks (Functions):**
Create reusable code blocks for complex actions
• Define new block "draw polygon"
• Use parameters for flexibility
• Reduces code repetition

**Broadcasting (Communication):**
Sprites can send messages to each other
```
Broadcast "game over"
When I receive "game over"
  Stop all sounds
  Say "Thanks for playing!"
```

**Lists (Arrays):**
Store multiple pieces of data
• Ghana regions list
• High scores
• Student names

**Sensing Blocks:**
Interact with users and environment
• Ask questions and wait for answers
• Detect mouse position
• Check if keys are pressed
• Use camera for motion detection

questions.question: Which Scratch block category contains the 'forever' loop block?
questions.explanation: Control blocks manage program flow, including loops like 'forever', 'repeat', and conditional statements.

questions.question: What happens when you click the green flag in Scratch?
options: Starts scripts with 'when green flag clicked'
questions.explanation: The green flag triggers all scripts that start with the 'when green flag clicked' event block.

exercises.title: Ghana Cultural Animations
exercises.instructions: Create interactive animations showcasing Ghanaian culture, festivals, or landmarks using Scratch.
exercises.hint: Start with simple movements and gradually add more complex interactions and sounds.

exercises.title: Simple Ghana-themed Games
exercises.instructions: Develop basic games incorporating Ghanaian elements like traditional foods, animals, or geography.
exercises.hint: Use sprites, scoring systems, and collision detection to create engaging gameplay.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana Geography Learning Game
scenarioChallenges.scenario: Create an educational game to help students learn Ghana's 16 regions and their capitals. The game should be interactive, fun, and provide feedback to help students learn. Include features like scoring, hints, and multiple difficulty levels.
tasks: Design game interface with Ghana map sprite
Create sprites for each region that highlight when clicked
Implement scoring system for correct answers
Add hint system for struggling players
Create different difficulty levels (regions only, capitals only, both)
Include sound effects and encouraging messages
Add a leaderboard system using lists
learningObjectives: Apply programming concepts to educational game design
Use variables, lists, and conditional statements effectively
Create user-friendly interfaces with clear feedback
Implement game mechanics like scoring and levels
Understand the connection between programming and education
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: Educational games can make learning Ghana's geography more engaging for students, helping them better understand their country's administrative structure and regional diversity.
